TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SoapRpcMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class SoapRpcMethodAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class SoapRpcMethodAttribute sealed : Attribute

summary.span: Specifies that SOAP messages sent to and from the method use formatting.

span.span: Specifies that SOAP messages sent to and from the method use formatting.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服务描述语言 (WSDL) 定义如何在 SOAP 消息中格式化的 XML Web 服务方法或操作中，两种风格：`RPC`和`Document`。Web Services Description Language (WSDL) defines two styles for how an XML Web service method, or operation, can be formatted in a SOAP message: `RPC` and `Document`. `RPC` 格式设置是指格式根据 SOAP 规范的使用针对 RPC; SOAP 操作也称为 SOAP 规范第 7 节。`RPC` formatting refers to formatting the operation according to the SOAP specification for using SOAP for RPC; otherwise known as Section 7 of the SOAP specification. `RPC` 设置状态的所有参数都封装在名为 XML Web 服务方法之后的单个 XML 元素和该 XML 元素中的每个 XML 元素表示命名的参数表示参数的格式。`RPC` formatting states that all parameters are encapsulated within a single XML element named after the XML Web service method and that each XML element within that XML element represents a parameter named after the parameter it is representing. 在这种格式的 SOAP 消息`RPC`和`Document`样式可用于与远程过程调用 (RPC) 的方式; 中的 XML Web 服务进行通信，但是`Document`样式也可以轻松可用于松散耦合方式进行通信方式。SOAP messages formatted in both the `RPC` and `Document` styles can be used to communicate with an XML Web service in a Remote Procedure Call (RPC) manner; however the `Document` style can also easily be used to communicate in a loosely coupled manner. 因此，`Document`推荐样式的 XML Web services。Therefore, `Document` style XML Web services is recommended. 有关更多详细信息，请参阅`Customizing SOAP Messages`主题。For more details, see the `Customizing SOAP Messages` topic. 有关更多详细信息，请参阅[自定义 SOAP 消息格式设置](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/dkwy2d72(v=vs.100))。For more details, see [Customizing SOAP Message Formatting](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/dkwy2d72(v=vs.100)). 此特性可以应用于 XML Web 服务方法在服务器上的和在客户端上的代理类。This attribute can be applied to an XML Web service method on the server and a proxy class on the client. XML Web 服务方法具有属性设置为`true`却可以访问其。XML Web service methods that have the property set to `true` do not have access to their . 在这种情况下，访问的属性的任何类返回`null`。As such, accessing any of the properties of the class return `null`. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将消息样式设置为`Rpc`为`GetUserName`XML Web 服务方法。The following code example sets the message style to `Rpc` for the `GetUserName` XML Web service method. [!code-aspx-csharp[SoapRpcMethodAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[SoapRpcMethodAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

summary.span: Gets or sets the HTTP header field of the SOAP request.

span.span: Gets or sets the HTTP header field of the SOAP request.

value.span: SOAP 请求的 HTTP 标头字段。

span.span: The HTTP header field of the SOAP request.

value.span: 默认值是http://tempuri.org/MethodName其中 MethodName 是 XML Web 服务方法的名称。

span.span: The default is http://tempuri.org/MethodName where MethodName is the name of the XML Web service method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常情况下，属性是一个 URI，该值指示 SOAP 请求的意图。Typically, the property is a URI indicating the intent of the SOAP request. 但是，SOAP 规范对不受限制的格式和是否在 URI 引用现有文档。However, the SOAP specification places no restrictions on the format and whether the URI refers to an existing document. 存在性和内容属性可以由 Web 服务器，如防火墙进行适当地筛选 SOAP 请求中 HTTP 消息。The presence and content of the property can be used by Web servers such as firewalls to appropriately filter SOAP request messages in HTTP. 默认情况下，.NET Framework 1.1 版发布中的属性`soapAction`属性的`soap:operation`为每个元素在 XML Web 服务生成的 WSDL 文档中支持 SOAP 绑定。By default, the .NET Framework version 1.1 publishes the property in the `soapAction` attribute of the `soap:operation` element for each supported SOAP binding in WSDL documents generated for an XML Web service. 支持的 SOAP 绑定为 SOAP 1.1。The supported SOAP binding is SOAP 1.1. 有关详细信息，请参阅[SOAP](https://www.w3.org/TR/soap/) W3C 网站上的规范。For more information, see the [SOAP](https://www.w3.org/TR/soap/) specification on the W3C website. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置属性设置为`http://www.contoso.com/Sample`。The following code example sets the property to `http://www.contoso.com/Sample`. [!code-aspx-csharp[SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Action#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Action/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Action#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Action/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Binding { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Binding : string with get, set

summary.span: Gets or sets the binding that an XML Web service method implements an operation for.

span.span: Gets or sets the binding that an XML Web service method implements an operation for.

value.span: XML Web 服务方法为其实现操作的绑定。

span.span: The binding an XML Web service method implements an operation for.

value.span: 默认值为"Soap"追加的 XML Web 服务的名称。

span.span: The default is the name of the XML Web service with "Soap" appended.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个绑定，定义的 Web 服务描述语言 (WSDL)，是类似于一个接口，它定义一组具体的操作。A binding, as defined by Web Services Description Language (WSDL), is similar to an interface in that it defines a concrete set of operations. 对于 ASP.NET，每个 XML Web 服务方法是在绑定内的操作。With respect to ASP.NET, each XML Web service method is an operation within a binding. XML Web 服务方法是 XML Web 服务的默认绑定或绑定中指定的成员应用于 XML Web 服务。XML Web service methods are members of the default binding for an XML Web service or a binding specified within a applied to an XML Web service. 如果多个 XML Web 服务可以实现多个绑定特性应用于 XML Web 服务。An XML Web service can implement multiple bindings, if multiple attributes are applied to an XML Web service. 一次一个或多个特性应用于 XML Web 服务或可应用于单个 XML Web 服务方法，以指示由特定的 XML Web 服务方法实现的绑定操作。Once one or more attributes are applied to an XML Web service, a or can be applied to individual XML Web service methods to indicate the binding operation implemented by a particular XML Web service method. 设置的属性或以指定的绑定 XML Web 服务方法为其实现操作。Set the property of or to specify the binding an XML Web service method implements an operation for. 只有一个或可以应用于 XML Web 服务方法。Only one or can be applied to an XML Web service method. 因此，XML Web 服务方法只能实现一个绑定的操作。Therefore, an XML Web service method can only implement an operation for one binding. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何实现 XML Web 服务中的多个绑定。The following code example demonstrates how to implement multiple bindings within an XML Web service. [!code-aspx-csharp[SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Binding#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Binding/CS/bindingcs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Binding#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute.Binding/VB/bindingvb.asmx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool OneWay { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.OneWay : bool with get, set

summary.span: Gets or sets whether an XML Web service client waits for the Web server to finish processing an XML Web service method.

span.span: Gets or sets whether an XML Web service client waits for the Web server to finish processing an XML Web service method.

value.span: 如果 XML Web 服务客户端不等待 Web 服务器完全处理 XML Web 服务方法;否则为。

span.span: if the XML Web service client does not wait for the Web server to completely process an XML Web service method; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当 XML Web 服务方法具有属性设置为`true`，XML Web 服务客户端不需要等待 Web 服务器完成处理 XML Web 服务方法。When an XML Web service method has the property set to `true`, the XML Web service client does not have to wait for the Web server to finish processing the XML Web service method. Web 服务器已反序列化时，就立即，但它将调用 XML Web 服务方法之前，服务器返回 HTTP 202 状态代码。As soon as the Web server has deserialized the , but before it invokes the XML Web service method, the server returns an HTTP 202 status code. HTTP 202 状态代码指示客户端 Web 服务器已开始处理消息。An HTTP 202 status code indicates to the client that the Web server has started processing the message. 因此，XML Web 服务客户端接收的 Web 服务器已成功处理该消息不发送任何确认。Therefore, an XML Web service client receives no acknowledgment that the Web server successfully processed the message. 单向方法不能有返回值或任何`out`参数。One-way methods cannot have a return value or any `out` parameters. 如果您使用的具有的.NET Framework 1.0 版 XML Web 服务方法或特性应用于它们与属性设置为`true`，不允许访问其使用静态属性。If you are using the .NET Framework version 1.0 XML Web service methods that have either the or attribute applied to them with the property set to `true`, do not allow access to their using the static property. 访问，派生类实现中的 XML Web 服务方法并访问属性。To access the , derive the class implementing the XML Web service method from and access the property. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置属性设置为`true`。The following code example sets the property to `true`. [!code-aspx-csharp[SoapRpcMethodAttribute.OneWay#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute.OneWay/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[SoapRpcMethodAttribute.OneWay#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapRpcMethodAttribute.OneWay/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性定义用于封装中的参数的 XML 元素`Body`SOAP 响应的元素。The property defines the XML element used to encapsulate the parameters within the `Body` element of the SOAP response. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置属性设置为`MyCustomResponseElement`。The following code example sets the property to `MyCustomResponseElement`.
